content.description: This route requires a bit of aid to reach the first placements. 2 Bolts to tug on protect the first section which leads to a rounded flake and then great climbing on flakes and cracks above with solid gear placements. Pull the roof and climb some Brain Plates to the anchors out right that are shared with the route to the right. Save some medium nuts if you want to have fun protecting the "grey matter" like features from the roof to the anchors. Suggested beta would be for the follower to clean on TR due to the anchors trending right.
content.protection:
4 bolts. First 2 are for A0 moves.

Gear at 1-4"
content.location: Second bolts from the left. 20 feet right of Block head and the leaning boulder.

content.description: Very short route right side of Half Day Dome.
content.location: Right of Hole In The Wall'

content.description: Start at the big ledge and follow the line of bolts up the dihedral, then up the arete to the top of the wall.
content.location: This is the next line, left of Hole in The Wall.

content.description: Start at the ledge and follow the line of bolts to the top of the wall. Bring a cam or two to protect the climbing from the second to third bolt.
content.protection:
9 bolts. gear to 1" to protect section from 2nd to 3rd bolts.

Bolted anchor
content.location: On top of the big ledge, to the left of Dogleg Dilemma.

content.description:
Crux starts off the ground, trends a quick left and slumps you into a knee bar to progress over the roof. The feet are there and seem to always be ticked.

Outstanding flow and movement. Eases up substantially into easy 5th moves after the knee bar.
content.location:
Left of the inverted, short, right-trending 11a handcrack

Edges on the right and a lip to the left with pinpoint feet starts up the first 2 bolts

content.description: Climb the steep hand crack up and right to the arete, and around and up to the top of the wall.
content.location: The last climb on the far right side of Half Day Dome.

content.description: Start by using 2 or 3 aid bolts on smooth slab, then free face climbing past 4 more bolts. Use small gear over the bulge. One final bolt leads tot the anchor
content.location: Between Too slick to Stick and Burning Biceps. Right most of the 3 bolted routes on the left side of this dome.

content.description:
Follow the left diagonal crack, then up a small roof where it joins Chipless Treat, and to the top of the wall.

A #4 C4 is useful in the wide section at the beginning of the climb, but not necessary.
content.protection:
Single set to 4" with a few extras on finger size. 1 bolt high up before reaching the anchors.

Bolted anchors
content.location: This is the next line, right of Chipless Treat. Find the obvious crack in the middle of the Dome.

content.description: Undercling crack to face with bolts.
content.protection: Pro .5" to 4" bolts to bolted anchor.
content.location: Left of, Getting In The Zone.

content.description: Start out under the leaning boulder and grovel your way to the freeable slab. Climbing without any chimney tactics will warrant a harder grade. Slab climb up to the ledge and pull the roof via "Choose your own Adventure"... Left looks  bit easier while right on the arete gets hero points, either way you get bolts to clip
content.protection: 8 bolts and Chain anchor. GB mentions optional nuts but it seems the only gear placements would be a huge cam under the roof ( like 4" Cam) and is pretty unnecessary.
content.location: Left most route on the wall. Starts under the leaning boulder.
